feed.title: The Machine Learning for Socio-Technical Systems Lab at University of Rhode Island

entry.title: Dr. Brown is presenting at NSBE PDC
entry.content: NSBE’s Professional Development conference is a venue for working professionals to skill up. She is presenting the building a portfolio website workshop by invitation
entry.summary: NSBE’s Professional Development conference is a venue for working professionals to skill up. She is presenting the building a portfolio website workshop by invitation

entry.title: Dr. Brown is speaking in the Digital Defense Fund fall seminar series
entry.content: She is co-leading a session on AI basics titled, “Unmasking AI: the Mysteries and Magic of Artificial Intelligence”.
entry.summary: She is co-leading a session on AI basics titled, “Unmasking AI: the Mysteries and Magic of Artificial Intelligence”.

entry.title: Funding from the Survival and Flourishing Fund
entry.content: We received funding from the SFF Fairness Track to fund work developing a benchmark for fair data-driven decision making with LLMs. We will develop a benchmark for both data analytics style decision-making and training fair models on data. Then we will assess state of the art AI systems engaging in these tasks across various levels of AI agency.
entry.summary: We received funding from the SFF Fairness Track to fund work developing a benchmark for fair data-driven decision making with LLMs. We will develop a benchmark for both data analytics style decision-making and training fair models on data. Then we will assess state of the art AI systems engaging in these tasks across various levels of AI agency.

entry.title: Dr. Brown will be at NSBE Gold
entry.content: She will teach a full day Python training as well as host an AI Mythbusting Workshop
entry.summary: She will teach a full day Python training as well as host an AI Mythbusting Workshop

entry.title: ORCA-CAP Funding for Open Humanities
entry.content: In Collaboration with Madison Jones and Jeremiah Dyehouse we recieved an award from the Open Research Community Accelerator Catalytic Awards Program to build a reusable open source curriculum and hold a workshop for humanties scholars on the basics of open source. Our goal is to help humanities scholars embrace digitial methods without being locked into expensive, corporate controlled platforms.
entry.summary: In Collaboration with Madison Jones and Jeremiah Dyehouse we recieved an award from the Open Research Community Accelerator Catalytic Awards Program to build a reusable open source curriculum and hold a workshop for humanties scholars on the basics of open source. Our goal is to help humanities scholars embrace digitial methods without being locked into expensive, corporate controlled platforms.
